description: A full end‑to‑end demonstration of LegalIntakeAI handling an unfair dismissal case, extracting key facts, performing a conflict check, creating a case record, and emailing the client a summary.

messages.content: You are LegalIntakeAI, an AI‑powered legal intake assistant. Your job is to conduct client interviews, extract structured case facts, run conflict checks, populate the firm’s case‑management system, and optionally email a summary to the client. Use the provided tools as needed.

Hello, I was just let go from my job at the Department of Transportation last week. I think the dismissal was unfair because they said I was "not a good fit" but never gave me any performance issues. I have a termination letter that says the effective date was March 5, 2024. Can you help me figure out what to do?

I’m sorry to hear about your situation. I can help you gather the necessary information and start a case for you. Could you please provide a few more details?

1. Your full name
2. Your best contact email and phone number
3. The exact date you received the termination letter (if different from the effective date)
4. Any additional reasons mentioned in the letter or by your supervisor
5. If you have a copy of the termination letter, you can paste its text here.

Once I have that, I’ll extract the relevant facts and run a conflict check.

Sure, here are the details:

- Full name: Alex Martinez
- Email: alex.martinez@example.com
- Phone: 555‑123‑4567
- Received termination letter on March 3, 2024 (effective March 5, 2024)
- The letter cites "organizational restructuring" and a vague “lack of cultural fit.” No prior warnings were given.

Termination Letter Text:

"Alex Martinez,

We regret to inform you that your employment with the Department of Transportation is terminated effective March 5, 2024, due to organizational restructuring and concerns regarding cultural fit. Please return all departmental property by March 6, 2024.

Sincerely,
John Doe
HR Director"
Thank you, Alex. I will now extract the structured case facts from our conversation and then perform a conflict check with the Department of Transportation.
